sentence.text: The cause is not signal splatter ; the noise which annoys the deaf is at a much lower frequency .
It annoyed her intensely that she should have thought for a moment that the dreadful feeling she 'd experienced when he 'd told her he had an engagement was jealousy .
The knocking annoyed me so much that I tried to open the window .
Mr Maxwell annoyed councillors when he bought the six properties at above market prices and them boarded them up .
` Technology can help people who are non-musicians to express themselves , but it annoys me when these people say it 's more valid than the musicians who can actually play their instruments . "
It annoys me when I hear the criticisms that come from the Secretary of State for the Environment .
It annoyed her to think he had imagined she would do the same .
IT really annoyed me to see leaders of the public service unions on TV going on about how a pay freeze would be unacceptable to their members .
Leeds were annoying me at their sudden inability to keep the ball on the pitch , either kicking it off , or playing stupid passes up front ( down the middle ) straight to their keeper/defenders .
` Because ` e 's my mate , and it annoyed me at the time to see ` im get ahead of me . "

However , as a matter of principle it annoys Hon. Members to think that Welsh Members should adopt such an attitude , because millions of pounds of English taxpayers ' money are directed towards Wales .
he he was so good that he never annoyed anybody by silly remarks .
That was another thing that annoyed her about the child : she always had to find something nice to say .
If they annoy suck-holing , spittle-licking , brain-dead Tory scum like you so much , then they must be doing their job .
The Prime Minister dare not present a clear picture , because such a picture would annoy some group or other in the Tory party .
His eyesight was below par which disqualified him from being a pilot -- and annoyed him a lot -- but he passed out as a navigator .
At breakfast she occasionally annoyed us by reeling off lists of groceries we were all to pick up during the day and bring home in time for dinner .
